elements.content: In this exercise, please think of an UPCOMING situation that you expect will make you feel anxious, worried, or scared.

Pick a situation that you worry might go badly, or that you expect will evoke symptoms related to anxiety (e.g., racing heart, sweating). Any situation that will make you feel quite anxious or scared will work, as long as it is a situation that you’re likely to actually encounter.
Please describe the situation in a few words:

elements.question: Please describe the situation in a few words.

elements.title: Please imagine the situation as vividly as possible (i.e., so that it feels very real).
bullets: Try to imagine you are actually in the situation.
Play out the specific parts of the situation in your head.
Try to imagine using all your senses while you think about this situation. Think about the things you would see, hear, and smell if you were really in that situation.
Think about the kinds of things you would think or feel if you were actually there.

elements.content: Please click the "Begin" button below and play this situation in your head for the next 20 seconds. We will tell you when the 20 seconds are up–make sure the sound on your device is not muted.
We will tell you when the 20 seconds are up.

pages.question: How anxious did you feel (at the highest level of anxiety) as you completed the imagery task? Press on the bar to see the slider.

elements.question: How vividly did you imagine the situation?
How likely is it that this situation or task will turn out well versus turn out badly?
options: Very likely to turn out well
Somewhat likely to turn out well
Somewhat likely to turn out badly
Very likely to turn out badly

elements.question: If this situation did turn out badly, how well or badly would you be able to handle it?
